column4: I got 2 hard drive 1st is devoted to ubuntu ,swap etc. the second I use for storage I want to try out linuxmce, if I resize my second drive with enough free space for my storage and linuxmce , install linuxmce to my second drive will the existing grub manager pick it up without having to configure the multi boot?
it'll probably overwrite your grub but add your other Os's to it

I have no idea how it installs, I have the quick install dvd version, I guess I should just bite the bullet and see how it goes,btw can I use the same swap space for any linux distro or do they have to have their own?
yes you can share the swap partition
